title: Emergent Communication Protocol Learning for Task Offloading in Industrial Internet of Things. (arXiv:2401.12914v1 [cs.IT])
abstract: In this paper, we leverage a multi-agent reinforcement learning (MARL) framework to jointly learn a computation offloading decision and multichannel access policy with corresponding signaling. Specifically, the base station and industrial Internet of Things mobile devices are reinforcement learning agents that need to cooperate to execute their computation tasks within a deadline constraint. We adopt an emergent communication protocol learning framework to solve this problem. The numerical results illustrate the effectiveness of emergent communication in improving the channel access success rate and the number of successfully computed tasks compared to contention-based, contention-free, and no-communication approaches. Moreover, the proposed task offloading policy outperforms remote and local computation baselines.

translated_title: 工业物联网中的任务卸载的新型通信协议学习
translated_abstract: 本文利用多智能体强化学习框架来联合学习计算卸载决策和多信道接入策略以及对应的信令。具体而言，基站和工业物联网移动设备是需要合作以在截止时间限制内执行计算任务的强化学习智能体。我们采用新型的通信协议学习框架来解决这个问题。数值结果显示，相比于基于竞争、无竞争和无通信的方法，新型的通信协议能够提高信道接入成功率和成功计算任务的数量。此外，提出的任务卸载策略胜过远程计算和本地计算基准模型。
tldr: 本文提出了一种利用多智能体强化学习框架来解决工业物联网中任务卸载问题的新型通信协议学习方法，实验证明该方法能够提高信道接入成功率和成功计算任务的数量，并且胜过现有的远程计算和本地计算方法。
en_tdlr: This paper proposes a novel communication protocol learning method using a multi-agent reinforcement learning framework to solve the task offloading problem in the Industrial Internet of Things. The experimental results demonstrate that this method can improve the channel access success rate and the number of successfully computed tasks, outperforming existing remote and local computation methods.
